data.description: A comprehensive Python library for calculating popular technical indicators used in financial markets. This repository provides efficient implementations of indicators like Supertrend, RSI, ADX, Bollinger Bands, Heikin Ashi, and more. The goal is to offer a reliable foundation for analyzing market trends and creating trading strategies. - the-quantclub-iitbhu/Technical-indicators

      <p class="f4 tmp-mb-3 ">
        A comprehensive Python library for calculating popular technical indicators used in financial markets. This repository provides efficient implementations of indicators like Supertrend, RSI, ADX, Bollinger Bands, Heikin Ashi, and more. The goal is to offer a reliable foundation for analyzing market trends and creating trading strategies.

dir=\"auto\"\u003eA Python library for computing commonly used technical indicators in financial markets. This repository provides efficient and easy-to-use implementations of indicators that are vital for analyzing market trends, generating signals, and backtesting strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003chr\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e Supported includes the following technical indicators:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSupertrend\u003c/strong\u003e: Identifies trends and generates buy/sell signals based on volatility.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRSI (Relative Strength Index)\u003c/strong\u003e: Measures the magnitude of recent price changes to evaluate overbought or oversold conditions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStochastic Oscillator\u003c/strong\u003e: Compares a specific closing price to a range of its prices over time.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eADX (Average Directional Index)\u003c/strong\u003e: Quantifies trend strength and direction.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBollinger Bands\u003c/strong\u003e: Identifies overbought or oversold market conditions using a simple moving average and standard deviation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHeikin Ashi\u003c/strong\u003e: Smooths out price action for clearer trend identification.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e \u003cstrong\u003ePlanned Additions\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003cbr\u003e\nThis library is a work in progress. We aim to continuously expand it by adding more indicators, including:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMoving Average Convergence Divergence (\u003cstrong\u003eMACD\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFibonacci Retracement Levels\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIchimoku Cloud\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePivot Points\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAverage True Range (\u003cstrong\u003eATR\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003chr\u003e\n\u003cdiv <p dir="auto">A Python library for computing commonly used technical indicators in financial markets. This repository provides efficient and easy-to-use implementations of indicators that are vital for analyzing market trends, generating signals, and backtesting strategies.</p>
<hr>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"> Supported Indicators</h2><a id="user-content--supported-indicators" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink:  Supported Indicators" href="#-supported-indicators"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Currently, the library includes the following technical indicators:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>Supertrend</strong>: Identifies trends and generates buy/sell signals based on volatility.</li>
<li><strong>RSI (Relative Strength Index)</strong>: Measures the magnitude of recent price changes to evaluate overbought or oversold conditions.</li>
<li><strong>Stochastic Oscillator</strong>: Compares a specific closing price to a range of its prices over time.</li>
<li><strong>ADX (Average Directional Index)</strong>: Quantifies trend strength and direction.</li>
<li><strong>Bollinger Bands</strong>: Identifies overbought or oversold market conditions using a simple moving average and standard deviation.</li>
<li><strong>Heikin Ashi</strong>: Smooths out price action for clearer trend identification.</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto"> <strong>Planned Additions</strong>:<br>
This library is a work in progress. We aim to continuously expand it by adding more indicators, including:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Moving Average Convergence Divergence (<strong>MACD</strong>)</li>
<li>Fibonacci Retracement Levels</li>
<li>Ichimoku Cloud</li>
<li>Pivot Points</li>
<li>Average True Range (<strong>ATR</strong>)</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<hr>

<p dir="auto">This repository aims to:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Provide <strong>accurate implementations</strong> of commonly used technical indicators.</li>
<li>Grow into a <strong>comprehensive library</strong> for building and testing trading systems.</li>
<li>Help traders and developers <strong>learn, experiment, and innovate</strong> in financial markets.</li>
</ul>
<hr>

<p dir="auto">We welcome contributions to help grow this library!<br>

<ol dir="auto">
<li>Fork the repository.</li>
<li>Add your implementation in the <code>indicators/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Create a pull request explaining the added indicator and its use.</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto">Feel free to suggest new indicators or enhancements by <a href="https://github.com/your-username/technical-indicators/issues">opening an issue</a>.</p>

      <p class="f4 tmp-my-3">
        A comprehensive Python library for calculating popular technical indicators used in financial markets. This repository provides efficient implementations of indicators like Supertrend, RSI, ADX, Bollinger Bands, Heikin Ashi, and more. The goal is to offer a reliable foundation for analyzing market trends and creating trading strategies.
      </p>

metadata.description: A comprehensive Python library for calculating popular technical indicators used in financial markets. This repository provides efficient implementations of indicators like Supertrend, RSI, ADX, Bollinger Bands, Heikin Ashi, and more. The goal is to offer a reliable foundation for analyzing market trends and creating trading strategies. - the-quantclub-iitbhu/Technical-indicators
